alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:06PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lauderdale and northwestern Colbert Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 406 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Savannah to near Pineflat to 8 miles northwest of Jumpertown. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waterloo, Riverton, Wright, Threet and Margerum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Alabama.
